concept.title: Permanent Generation Size
concept.shortdesc: When you use the with Java 7, you can define the Java Permanent Generation size, also known as the PermGen size.

conbody.p: The PermGen size determines the amount of memory that the web application server uses. Define the PermGen size as part of the SDC_JAVA_OPTS property in the environment configuration file.

Use the following properties to define the PermGen size:
MaxPermSize - Set to 1/4 of the Java heap size, with a minimum of 128 MB.
PermSize - Set to 1/8 of the Java heap size, with a minimum of 128 MB.
Setting the properties higher than these guidelines can cause out of memory errors or cause the to fail to start.
